titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: I attended the Holy Communion at 8 a.m. & received the Sacrament. Budworth was the Celebrant. Then I preached to the soldiers at 10 a.m., taking the Robertson centenary as my subject. At Mattins I installed Macdonald as an honorary Canon, and after wards walked with him. After lunch I wrote letters to the Bishop of Durham and Carissima. After Evensong, Cruickshank & his wife came in to tea, Knowling & his niece, & M
Lowe. Then I wrote a number of letters.
